value.title: Dynamic filtering with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at taking URL filtering to the next level. He shows how to use dynamic filtering with Power BI reports. He also shows a neat trick of setting a link image for Web URL fields.  Filtering in Power BI: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/filter-a-report-with-a-url-query-string-parameter/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EXObcA9G9Vw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How do you use RLS with Power BI Embedded???
value.excerpt: Are you using Power BI Embedded and not sure how to implement Row-Level Security (RLS)? Adam shows you how!  Power BI Embedded Doc: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/embedded/embedded-row-level-security  Power BI Embedded Playground: https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/  GitHub

value.title: Microsoft Fabric Launch Digital Event (Day 2)
value.excerpt: Learn more about the exciting news about the launch of Microsoft Fabric in this two-day digital event. From Power BI, to Synapse, and Data Factory, you will be able to learn what’s available to you in this new offering.  Blog: https://aka.ms/build-with-analytics  #MicrosoftFabric

value.title: Power BI: Build a custom KPI scorecard
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how you can use Power BI to build a custom KPI scorecard. The key is the UNICHAR DAX function.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/lkHFpmA4SJ4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Revisiting a Power BI solution with Dynamic M Parameters
value.excerpt: Dynamic M Parameters for SQL are here in Power BI! YES!!! Let's revisit a Power BI solution and how we can take it to the next LEVEL using these!  LEVEL UP Power BI Conditional Drill with Paginated reports!  https://youtu.be/43CwBmaym8Q  Teo Lachev's Blog: https://prologika.com/power-bi-dynamic-m-query-parameters-reloaded/

value.title: Storytelling with Power BI and PowerPoint
value.excerpt: Give up those static images of your reports in PowerPoint! Learn how to integrate your Power BI report to help tell your story directly within PowerPoint!  Tell a story with your data. Announcing the all-new Power BI integration for PowerPoint https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/tell-a-story-with-your-data-announcing-the-all-new-power-bi-integration-for-powerpoint/

value.title: Get a field value from a related table in Power BI DAX RELATED Function Explained
value.excerpt: Sometimes, in Power BI, you need to access a field’s value from another table that somehow is related to the existing table. You can use Power Query transformations such as combining Merge with something else. However, this can be needed when you write a DAX expression too. In this article and video,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/GqxECuWRiio" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. value.title: Page Level Security workaround in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you want to control the access to the Power BI report pages (or tabs) in a way that some users see some pages, and some others see other pages, we need something called page-level security. However, Power BI, as of today, doesn’t support visual-level or page-level security. There is a workaround to

value.title: What a Power BI Hierarchy Is and How to Use it

A hierarchy can be created simply and can add great value for you as a developer and end-users for better data analysis. In this article and video, I’ll explain what a Power BI hierarchy is and how to create it.
